name: Honduras
description: Honduras, often referred to as the ‘Pearl of Central America,’ is a nation brimming with diverse landscapes, from the lush rainforests of the Mosquitia to the rugged peaks of the Sierra Madre mountains and the pristine Caribbean coastline.  It’s a country of vibrant culture, rich history, and significant biodiversity, facing challenges related to deforestation and climate change. Honduras boasts a complex and fascinating past, shaped by indigenous Maya civilizations, Spanish colonization, and a long struggle for independence.  Today, it’s a developing nation striving for economic stability and sustainable development.

quickFacts.label: Capital
quickFacts.description: The political and administrative center of Honduras.
quickFacts.detail: Located in the western highlands, Tegucigalpa is a bustling city with a mix of colonial architecture and modern development.

quickFacts.label: Population
quickFacts.description: The 10th most populous country in Central America.
quickFacts.detail: The population is largely concentrated in urban areas, particularly Tegucigalpa and San Pedro Sula.

quickFacts.label: Area
quickFacts.description: A relatively small country with diverse geographical features.
quickFacts.detail: Honduras is bordered by Nicaragua to the north, Guatemala to the south, and the Caribbean Sea and Pacific Ocean to the east and west, respectively.

quickFacts.label: Official Language
quickFacts.description: The primary language spoken throughout the country.
quickFacts.detail: Indigenous languages, such as Garifuna and Maya, are also spoken in various regions.

quickFacts.label: Currency
quickFacts.detail: The exchange rate fluctuates, but approximately 20 Lempiras equals 1 US Dollar.

quickFacts.label: GDP (2023)
quickFacts.description: A developing economy with significant potential.
quickFacts.detail: The economy is heavily reliant on agriculture, manufacturing, and services.

climateData.title: Climate Overview
climateData.description: Honduras experiences a tropical climate with variations depending on altitude and region. The coastal areas are hot and humid year-round, while the highlands are cooler and drier.  Rainfall is generally abundant, particularly during the rainy seasons.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Dry Season
seasonalCharacteristics.description: The dry season is characterized by sunny skies, low humidity, and minimal rainfall. It's the most popular time for tourism.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Rainy Season
seasonalCharacteristics.description: The rainy season brings frequent showers and thunderstorms, particularly in the afternoons.  However, the rain is often short-lived, and the landscape remains lush and vibrant.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Hurricane Season
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Honduras is vulnerable to hurricanes and tropical storms during this period.  Residents and tourists should monitor weather forecasts closely.
activities: Limited outdoor activities during storm warnings

naturalWonders.name: Rio Platano Biosphere Reserve
naturalWonders.description: A UNESCO World Heritage Site, the Rio Platano Biosphere Reserve encompasses a vast area of rainforest along the Caribbean coast. It’s a critical habitat for numerous endangered species and showcases the region’s incredible biodiversity.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: This reserve is a complex of rivers, lakes, and wetlands, supporting a diverse array of flora and fauna, including jaguars, tapirs, and numerous bird species.  It’s a vital area for scientific research and conservation.

naturalWonders.name: Copán Ruins
naturalWonders.description: Copán Ruins are a remarkable Mayan archaeological site located in western Honduras.  They offer a fascinating glimpse into the sophisticated culture and artistry of the ancient Maya civilization.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The ruins include temples, palaces, plazas, and ball courts, showcasing the advanced architectural and astronomical knowledge of the Maya.  The intricate carvings and hieroglyphs provide valuable insights into their history and beliefs.
viewingTips: Hire a guide to learn about the site's history

scientificData.Population: At its peak, estimated at 12,000-25,000 inhabitants

naturalWonders.name: Monte Ruma
naturalWonders.description: Monte Ruma, part of the Sierra Madre de Honduras, is a stunning mountain range offering breathtaking views and challenging hiking trails. It’s a haven for birdwatchers and nature enthusiasts.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The mountain is known for its diverse flora and fauna, including cloud forests and endemic species.  The summit provides panoramic views of the surrounding landscape.

biodiversityCategory.name: Tropical Rainforests
biodiversityCategory.description: Honduras is home to extensive tropical rainforests, representing a significant portion of Central America’s rainforest cover. These forests are incredibly diverse and play a crucial role in regulating the region’s climate.

statistics.details: Honduras boasts an exceptionally high number of plant species, many of which are endemic.
A significant proportion of Honduras’s mammal species are found nowhere else on Earth.

notableSpecies.name: Jaguar
notableSpecies.significance: A top predator in the rainforest ecosystem.

notableSpecies.name: Tapir
notableSpecies.significance: An important seed disperser and herbivore.

ecosystemData.title: Honduran Ecosystems
ecosystemData.overview: Honduras’s ecosystems are incredibly diverse, ranging from tropical rainforests and cloud forests to coastal wetlands and dry forests. These ecosystems provide essential services, including carbon sequestration, water regulation, and habitat for countless species.

conservationStatus.protectedAreas: Approximately 15% of the country’s land area is protected in national parks and reserves.

biodiversityCategories.name: Tropical Rainforests
biodiversityCategories.description: The dominant ecosystem, characterized by high rainfall and biodiversity.

statistics.details: Supports lush vegetation and abundant wildlife.
Creates a complex and layered forest structure.

biodiversityCategories.name: Coastal Wetlands
biodiversityCategories.description: Important habitats for migratory birds and marine life.

statistics.details: Provides coastal protection and nursery grounds for fish.

activities.title: Outdoor Activities in Honduras
activities.description: Honduras offers a wide range of outdoor activities for adventure seekers and nature lovers. From hiking and wildlife viewing to water sports and cultural experiences, there’s something for everyone.

activityCategories.name: Hiking
activityCategories.description: Explore the country’s diverse landscapes on foot.

activities.name: Copán Ruins Trail
activities.description: A scenic trail leading to the Copán Ruins, offering stunning views of the surrounding jungle.

activities.name: Monte Ruma Summit Hike
activities.description: A challenging hike to the summit of Monte Ruma, rewarding hikers with panoramic views.
activities.requirements: Sturdy hiking boots, layers of clothing, water, snacks

activityCategories.name: Water Sports
activityCategories.description: Enjoy the Caribbean and Pacific coasts with a variety of water activities.

activities.name: Scuba Diving in Roatán
activities.description: Explore the vibrant coral reefs and marine life of Roatán, a world-renowned diving destination.

activities.name: White Water Rafting on the Río Frio
activities.description: Experience the thrill of white water rafting on the Río Frio, navigating through exciting rapids.

clothing.winter: Layers of clothing, jacket, sweater, long pants

equipment.basic: Sunscreen, insect repellent, flashlight, first-aid kit
